transliteration: Chalantant Chaayan|| Jujhantant Jaayan|| Ranankant Naadan|| Bajantant Baadan||203||
translation: The warriors are fighting with each other with great zeal and the musical instruments are being and played in the battlefield.203.

transliteration: Puantant Patree|| Lagadtant Atree|| Bajantant Atran|| Jujhantant Chhatran||204||
translation: The tips of the arms and weapons are entering the bodies and the Kshatriyas are striking their arms and weapons in the battlefield.204.

transliteration: Giranant Bhoomee|| Outhantant Jhoomee|| Ratantant Paanan|| Jujhantant Juaanan||205||
translation: The warriors falling on the earth and then swinging up and fighting are shouting for water.205.

transliteration: Chalantant Baanan|| Roukantant Desaanan|| Girantant Bderan|| Bhajantant Bhderan||206||
translation: The directions have disappeared by the discharge of arrows; the warriors are falling and the cowards are running away.206.

transliteration: Nachanndant Eesan|| Puanntant Seesan|| Bajantant Lauroo|| Bhramanndant Bhauroo||207||
translation: Shiva while dancing and playing his tabor is roaming and wearing the rosaries of skulls.207.

transliteration: Nachanndant Baalan|| Toutantant Taalan|| Machanndant Vderan|| Bhajantant Bhderan||208||
translation: The heavenly damsels are dancing and with the dreadful fighting by warriors and running away by the cowards, there is a break in the tune.208.

transliteration: Lagadtant Baanan|| Dhahantant Juaanan|| Katantant Addhan|| Bhatantant Baddhan||209||
translation: The warriors fall on being struck by the arrows and the headless trunks of the warriors are being chopped through the middle.209.

gurmukhi: KhMqMq KUnI ]cVY caup dUnI ]bhMqMq AqRM ]ktMqMq CqRM ]210]
transliteration: Khahantant Khoonee|| Chadai Chaoup Doonee|| Bahantant Atran|| Katantant Chhatran||210||
translation: The blood-spilling warriors are fighting with double zeal and with the blows of the arms, the canopies of the warriors being cut down, are falling.210.

transliteration: Bahantant Pattree|| Jujhantant Attree|| Hinankant Taajee|| Kananchhant Gadjee||211||
translation: The tips of the striking arms are piercing the bodies; the horses are neighing and the warriors are thundering.211.

transliteration: Toutantant Charman|| Katantant Baramannd|| Girantant Bhoomee|| Outhantant Ghoomee||212||
translation: The shields and the armours are being cut; the warriors are falling on the earth and getting up while swinging.212.

transliteration: Ratantant Paanan|| Katantant Juaanan|| Udantant Ekan|| Gadantant Nekan||213||
translation: The hands have fought with hands; the young soldiers being chopped and the arrows, flying numerously are being planted in the bodies.213.

gurmukhi: AnUp rUp id`K kY su kRu`D joDxM brM ]sn`Db`D au`idqM su kop Ep dy rxM ]
transliteration: Anoop Roop Dikkh Kais U Kruddh Jodhanan Baran|| Sanaddh-baddh Udditan Su Kop Op De Ranan||
translation: Seeing the unique beauty, the warriors are getting infuriated and wearing their weapons are reaching in the war-arena;

gurmukhi: chMq jYq pqRxM krMq Gwv du`DrM ]qutMq AsqR SsqRxo lsMq au`jlo PlM ]214]
transliteration: Chahant Jait Patranan Karant Ghaav Duddharan|| Toutant Astra Shastrano Lasant Ujjalo Phalan||214||
translation: The warriors are inflicting wounds from both the sides and are hoping to get the declaration of victory; with the breakage of weapons, their bright tips are being seen.214.
